ai-thag17.2:1.2_0: diligent as per their intentions and meditation,
ai-thag17.2:1.4_0: that is what they call a mendicant.
ai-thag17.2:2.1_0: When eating fresh or dried food,

ai-thag17.2:6.3_0: and that there’s nothing between the two—
ai-thag17.2:6.4_0: what keeps you in the world? What would you become?

ai-thag17.2:10.1_0: But one who gives up proliferates,
ai-thag17.2:12.2_0: Though most people don’t like it,
ai-thag17.2:12.3_0: those free of greed are happy there,
ai-thag17.2:12.4_0: not those who seek sensual pleasures.

ai-thag17.2:18.1_0: “His only shelter is the foot of a tree;
ai-thag17.2:18.3_0: the senior monk foremost in wisdom,

ai-thag17.2:20.3_0: A mendicant who has ended delusion

ai-thag17.2:34.1_0: “The senior monk who keeps the wheel rolling,
ai-thag17.2:34.2_0: he is very wise and serene.
ai-thag17.2:34.3_0: Like earth, like water, like fire,
ai-thag17.2:34.4_0: he is neither attracted nor repelled.
ai-thag17.2:35.1_0: He has attained the perfection of wisdom,
ai-thag17.2:35.3_0: He is bright, but seems to be dull;
ai-thag17.2:36.4_0: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.”
